description.narrative: Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 Support to the second phase of the Joint UN Programme on Social Protection 2019-2022. Agreement partner is UNICEF and the participating UN Organisations are WFP and ILO. The first phase was implemented between 2016 and 2019 and was supported by Finland, Ireland, UK and Sweden. The continuation builds upon the results and lessons learned in the first phase but is more focused on building systems and capacity around the social cash transfers for the poorest in Zambia. Other important Components of the programme are mainstreaming of gender and disability, improved nutrition for pregnant and lactating mothers as well as increased development effects through enhanced operational links between social cash transfers and other initiatives, so called cash+. An additional component deals with Emergecy Cash Transfers during 2019 and 2022 to households in districts that are hardest hit by the prolonged reduced rainfalls. The programme is to be funded by Sweden and UK.

Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Insatsen gäller stöd om 60 000 000 SEK till den andra fasen av Joint UN Programme on Social Protection under åren 2019 - 2022. Avtalspart är UNICEF och medverkande FN-organisationer är WFP och ILO. Den första fasen genomfördes mellan 2016 och 2019 och fick stöd av Finland, Irland, UK samt Sverige. Fortsättningen bygger vidare på resultat och erfarenheter från den första fasen och har ett något snävare fokus på i första hand att bygga system och kapacitet kring socialbidragssystemet för de allra fattigaste i Zambia. Ytterligare viktiga komponenter är integrering av jämställdhet, anpassning för funktionshindrade, förbättrad nutrition för gravida och ammande kvinnor samt system för ökade utvecklingseffekter genom förbättrade länkar mellan socialbidrag och andra insatser sk Cash+. En ytterligare komponent gäller utbetalning av extra socialbidrag under 2019 och 2020 till mottagare i distrikt som är särskilt drabbade av torka. Programmets ska finansieras gemensamt av Sverige och UK.

The Joint UN Programme on Social Protection phase II has the following expected results: Impact: Reduced Multi-dimentional poverty Outcomes: 1. Predictable and regular Social Cash Transfers 2. Operational Cash+ linkages 3. Improved nutrition 4. Disability mainstreaming 5. Improved cluster perfomace In addition the programme has a component of Emergency Cash Transfers with payments during 2019 and 2020 to social cash beneficiaries in the districts hardest hit by the prolonged reduced rainfall.

sector.narrative: Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

tag.narrative: 1.3 - Införa nationellt lämpliga system och åtgärder för socialt skydd för alla, inklusive grundskydd, och senast 2030 säkerställa att de omfattar en väsentlig andel av de fattiga och de utsatta.
1.3 - Implement nationally appropriate social protection systems and measures for all, including floors, and by 2030 achieve substantial coverage of the poor and the vulnerable.

1.5 - Till 2030 bygga upp motståndskraften hos de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer och minska deras utsatthet och sårbarhet för extrema klimatrelaterade händelser och andra ekonomiska, sociala och miljömässiga chocker och katastrofer.

1.5 - By 2030, build the resilience of the poor and those in vulnerable situations and reduce their exposure and vulnerability to climate-related extreme events and other economic, social and environmental shocks and disasters.

2.2 - Senast 2030 avskaffa alla former av undernäring, bland annat genom att senast 2025 nå de internationellt överenskomna målen i fråga om tillväxthämning och undervikt bland barn under fem år, samt tillgodose tonårsflickors, gravida och ammande kvinnors samt äldre personers näringsbehov.

2.2 - By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving, by 2025, the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under 5 years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women and older persons.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The programme started in August 2019 and is building on the achivements during phase 1. The work plan was revised during 2020 to adjust to covid-19 and to add support to Zambia Covid-19 contingency plan through covid-19 emergency cash transfers. Important achievements during the period include: - Zambia Integrated Social Protection Information System (ZISPIS) launched in Chililabombwe district and system testing/ payments done in Nyimba and Chililabombwe Districts. - Implementation of Griveance Mechanism pilots in Phase I districts ongoing as well as in the ECT districts. - Financial management software, Navision, operational and currently being used for reporting under Central province. - SCT systems being used as basis for Covid-19 Emergency Cash Transfer payments, adding on tailored tools, such as tollfree SMS GM. - Multi-agency Cash plus task team constituted (MCDSS, MoF, MNDP, ZIPAR, ZRA, ZSA) - Cash-Plus Concept note under custody of MCDSS for consideration by executive through the cabinet memorandum. - Implementation Research on Nutrition pilot protocol developed - Development of disability mainstreaming protocol - Social protection budget tracking and service delivery monitoring report done with CSPR - Social assistance chapter submitted for Social Protection Bill Drought Emergency Cash Transfers (D-ECT) - Completion of cycle one payment: 90,202 HHs reached. - Commencement of Cycle two D-ECT payments and positive progress recorded so far in the disbursements to beneficiaries. - Inclusion of mobile money payments COVID- 19 Emergency Cash Transfers (C-ECT) - Preparatory activities to prepare C-ECT implementation - Resource mobilization activities for C-ECT
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
